name: College Football Helmets 2005 Quiz | NCAA Football | 10 Questions

questions.text: In 2005, which member of the Big 10 wore plain white helmets with no logo?
questions.explanation:
Penn State.

	The Nittany Lions began wearing the plain white helmets in 1975, having featured players' numerals on the sides prior to then.

questions.text: In 2005, the helmet of which Atlantic Coast Conference team was orange with a white pawprint?
questions.explanation:
Clemson.

	The Tigers' helmets had featured a pawprint beginning in 1976.  Prior to then, the letter "C" provided the logo.

questions.text: In 2005, the helmet of which member of the Mountain West Conference was dark green with a gold rams horn logo?
questions.explanation:
Colorado State.

	The logo on the Rams' helmets is similair to that of the St Louis Rams of the NFL.

questions.text: In 2005, which member of the Southeastern Conference wore old gold helmets with a logo consisting of the school initial in white inside a black star?
questions.explanation:
Vanderbilt.

	The Commodores' helmets have featured various logos, with the star and letter V featuring in most of them.

questions.text: In 2005, 10 of the 12 members of the Big 12 wore helmets which included the school initial(s) as all or part of the logo. Which were the two colleges that had helmets which did not include the school initials?
questions.explanation:
Kansas State and Texas.

	The Kansas State Wildcats wore silver helmets with a cats' head logo in purple. The Texas Longhorns wore white helmets with a longhorn logo in orange.

questions.text: In 2005, which member of the Pac 10 wore white helmets with the school initial(s) in red?
questions.explanation:
Stanford.

	The Cardinal wore plain white helmets until the late 1960s when the letter S was added.

questions.text: In 2005, which member of the Mid-American Conference wore white helmets with the school name in green letters?
questions.explanation:
Ohio.

	The Bobcats have featured many different logos, including a pawprint and an outline of the state of Ohio.

questions.text: In 2005, which member of the Big East wore orange helmets with the players' numeral in navy blue?
questions.explanation:
Syracuse.

	The Orange had worn plain orange helmets for many years before adding player numerals in 2005.

questions.text: In 2005, which member of the Western Athletic Conference wore red helmets which included an outline of their state as part of the logo?
questions.explanation:
Louisiana Tech.

	The Bulldogs' helmets were red with a logo that included the state outlined in solid blue, and a letter 'T' in white.

questions.text: There were only four independent colleges playing Division 1-A football in 2005. Three of those schools wore plain gold helmets with no logo.  Which was the only one that did not?
questions.explanation:
Temple.

	The Owls, who left the Big East after the 2004 season, wore dark red helmets with a letter T in red and white.
